{"step_by_step_thinking": "TMJ stands for temporomandibular joint, which is the joint that connects the jawbone to the skull. The development of TMJ refers to the formation and maturation of this joint. To determine the age at which TMJ develops, we need to consider the embryonic development of the jaw and skull. The temporomandibular joint starts to form during the embryonic period, which occurs between weeks 4 and 8 of gestation. By week 10, the jaw and skull structures continue to develop, including the formation of the temporomandibular joint. Therefore, the correct answer is B. 10 weeks.", "answer_choice": "B"}
